Class BoardInit

  • public class BoardInit
extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void chessInit()
      This method is used to initialize the chess board and set the bit board values for all the different pieces.
      static void stringToBitBoard(java.lang.String[][] chessBoard, long WP, long WR, long WN, long WB, long WQ, long WK, long BP, long BR, long BN, long BB, long BQ, long BK)
      This method is used to set the bit board values of various pieces using the string representation of the chess board.

      • chessInit

        public static void chessInit()
        This method is used to initialize the chess board and set the bit board values for all the different pieces.

      • stringToBitBoard

        public static void stringToBitBoard(java.lang.String[][] chessBoard,
                                    long WP,
                                    long WR,
                                    long WN,
                                    long WB,
                                    long WQ,
                                    long WK,
                                    long BP,
                                    long BR,
                                    long BN,
                                    long BB,
                                    long BQ,
                                    long BK)
        This method is used to set the bit board values of various pieces using the string representation of the chess board.
        Parameters:
        chessBoard - String representation of the state of chess board
        WP - Bit Board Representation of White Pawn
        WR - Bit Board Representation of White Rook
        WN - Bit Board Representation of White Knight
        WB - Bit Board Representation of White Bishop
        WQ - Bit Board Representation of White Queen
        WK - Bit Board Representation of White King
        BP - Bit Board Representation of Black Pawn
        BR - Bit Board Representation of Black Rook
        BN - Bit Board Representation of Black Knight
        BB - Bit Board Representation of Black Bishop
        BQ - Bit Board Representation of Black Queen
        BK - Bit Board Representation of Black King
